18:02 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:48 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi  
18:48 <vmassol> have you seen this: http://www.ehackingnews.com/2012/02/xwiki-web-application-vulnerable-to.html ?  
18:48 <vmassol> cjd: you might be interested too!  
18:48 <vmassol> note that I"ve just removed his comment on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/XWikiEnterprise14RC1Released  
18:49 <vmassol> haven't touched http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/XWiki/SonyStyles yet  
18:49 <@sdumitriu> Yeah...  
18:50 <@sdumitriu> That will always be possible until we remove support for the HTML macro completely  
18:51 <@sdumitriu> Still, that's plain HTML, not a HTML macro... Wonder why it's executed  
19:05 <vmassol> we need to reply to this  
19:05 <vmassol> it's being retweeted...  
19:10 <vmassol> do we have a page on xwiki.org explaining what we do to prevent security issues?  
19:11 <vmassol> we could have one explaining that and reply by writing a blog post pointing to it + point to our security list when a security issue is found and then reply to the tweet with the blog post?  
19:12 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
19:12 <sdumitriu1> None that I can remember  
19:13 <sdumitriu> has quit

22:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: any idea about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/1035/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_XWiki\_u002C\_page\_CoreExtensions\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/ ?  
22:26 <vmassol> could it be something you committed recently?.  
22:26 <@sdumitriu> Checking  
22:26 <@sdumitriu> Could be, I'll check  
22:26 <vmassol> the problem is the velocity warning  
22:26 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I know
